content.text:
# Draft:Afro-American Republican League

The Afro-American Republican League was an organization in Pennsylvania.
https://www.phmc.state.pa.us/bah/aaGuide/AA-MG-171.html
In Green County, a group was organized at the Bethel African Methodist Episcopal Church in 1899.
Robert J. Nelson (Robert John Nelson) served as its president. F. L. Jefferson served as Secretary.
Peter S. Blackwell was involved in it.
Afro-American League of Western Pennsylvania
"Russell, June 18, 1898, Afro-American Republican League to. Daniel L. Russell, June 25, 1898, Russell Papers." [https://www.jstor.org/stable/23518178]
William Caitlin tried to split off a Western Pennsylvania group from the organization in 1899.
See also
*Mother Bethel A.M.E. Church
References
